Metadata.Summary:
=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=
     SUMMARY FOR STORY "Paragate" by SavantGuarde:
=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=
 > Word count is 192,744.
 > There are 5 acts, 53 chapters, and 156 scenes.
 > This manuscript averages:
   - 1235 words per scene.
   - 3636 words per chapter.
   - 2.94 scenes per chapter.
 > Out of 156 planned scenes, 128 are written.
 > So the Zero Draft is approximately 82.0% complete.

ChapterList.Summary: Cody celebrates his first home, drunkenly stumbles through the adjoining door into another world, is healed by strangers, and fixates on the "cosplayer" girl on the other side.
ChapterList.Blurb: A housewarming goes sideways when Cody opens the wrong door—and stumbles into a world that shouldn't exist.

ChapterList.Summary: Katiya's intro: she struggles to relax, Aldrin frames trainee expectations, and she reconnects with Jullian as they "christen" her new place.
ChapterList.Blurb: Katiya tries to unwind, but duty—and an old flame—won't let her rest.

ChapterList.Summary: Cody's bleak office day: roasted for late redlines, awkward beat with Kei, then family unpacking with Miguel queued up for drinks.
ChapterList.Blurb: Another soul-numbing office day pushes Cody toward a choice he's not ready to make.

ChapterList.Summary: Katiya's trauma baseline: nightmares of Hillfar; she self-stabilizes, starts her day, meets Derry & Carmen (Rayna foreshadow), and heads to base with Bertram.
ChapterList.Blurb: Nightmares, neighbors, and a base run: Katiya fights panic with routine until routine fights back.

ChapterList.Summary: Cody + Miguel bro out, drink hard; Miguel crashes, Cody stays up.
ChapterList.Blurb: Drinks with a best friend turn into confessions—and an idea Cody should ignore.

ChapterList.Summary: Katiya's first day ends in panic when a distant light (Firebrand tie-in) appears; town responds; on returning home she finds an intruder—Cody—and ambushes him.
ChapterList.Blurb: A distant light rattles Gaffesend; Katiya's first day ends with an intruder at home.

ChapterList.Summary: Prologue re-seen through Katiya: she crosses into the modern world and recoils, landing back through the door—mirror of Cody's intro.
ChapterList.Blurb: Through Katiya's eyes: a door, a modern nightmare, and a blur she can't unsee. and violence.

ChapterList.Summary: Third clash: Katiya (assuming Auvryan assassin) and Cody fight to another misunderstanding; she drives him back through the door.
ChapterList.Blurb: Misread motives turn their encounter into a full-on clash.

ChapterList.Summary: Cody tries to rationalize it away (no wound); barricades the door; nearly late to work; meets foil Reed.
ChapterList.Blurb: Cody barricades more than a door as reality refuses to make sense.

ChapterList.Summary: Katiya cleans to stave off panic, studies Cody's device; time skip: a month later she hesitates during a royal escort, barely averts disaster, is berated, and runs to find Bertram.
ChapterList.Blurb: A month later, a public moment goes wrong—and Katiya can't shake the blame.

ChapterList.Summary: Another month later: Cody is bored while Reed earns praise; Nav spins up a new project; Cody ghosts social invites, but hears pleading through the door at home.
ChapterList.Blurb: Praise falls on the wrong desk. At home, Cody hears a voice on the other side.

ChapterList.Summary: FOUR WEEK TIME SKIPKatiya, Ryder, and Paxton rescue near-dead Bertram; she's blamed and shut out—her only remaining lifeline is Cody.
ChapterList.Blurb: With help scarce, Katiya runs toward the only lifeline left.

ChapterList.Summary: Katiya crosses mid-panic; Cody calms her and lets her sleep; awkward breakfast; they agree to "no interfering" (both intend to break it).
ChapterList.Blurb: A midnight crossing. A stranger's kindness. Rules they'll both pretend to follow.

ChapterList.Summary: Cody gives her a gentle orientation day: first car ride (terrifying), Costco errand gauntlet—Katiya is overwhelmed by the future.
ChapterList.Blurb: "Welcome to the future." A car ride and a big-box errand become an emotional obstacle course.

ChapterList.Summary: Cody runs Katiya's route in Gaffesend; she tours him as "royal inventor"; awkward Jullian moment; tavern hang where Cody fits in.
ChapterList.Blurb: Cody tours Katiya's world—and fits in a little too well.

ChapterList.Summary: Cody's spark flickers: nostalgia and lunch with Alan (Jackson talk); he returns hoping for an open door.
ChapterList.Blurb: A lunch with Dad. A memory of a brother. A door that might be open tonight.

ChapterList.Summary: Katiya visits Bertram in the hospital (promises Hillfar); market duty goes sideways; she chases and collars Rayna (Ahkvasan half-blood); Jullian downplays her leap; Cody leaves a treat.
ChapterList.Blurb: Katiya chases a thief and a ghost from her past—while promises tug her toward tomorrow.

ChapterList.Summary: Cody's volunteer training day: Katiya teases, his mistake catches Aldrin's eye; later he chooses friendship over victory in a challenge—character beat.
ChapterList.Blurb: A training mishap puts Cody on someone important's radar for all the wrong reasons.

ChapterList.Summary: Open house at Cody's work: meet Reed & Kei; Cody geeks out, Katiya meets Alan & Kim; they overhear Reed/Kei on Cody missing from the "Future Talent" wall.
ChapterList.Blurb: Open house at work: new faces, old history, and a wall Cody isn't on.

ChapterList.Summary: Katiya engineers a Cody—Kei date; in parallel she and Jullian go to hot springs and bristle; Cody's date feels off and foggy—he insists he's "fine."
ChapterList.Blurb: Double dates, mixed signals, and the uneasy question: are we still who we were?

ChapterList.Summary: Katiya extracts an uncomfortable truth from Jullian; intercut meltdown date beats (both couples misfire); Cody & Kei hook up but it lands as empty.
ChapterList.Blurb: Cold water and hard truths—two relationships strain to the breaking point.

ChapterList.Summary: Katiya passes core exams but shoots poorly; Aryn is unflappable; Cody and Reed clash about what a Level-1 is; Katiya insists on leading the next team exam, feeling off her game.
ChapterList.Blurb: Tests expose strengths, flaws, and a calm rival who never seems to miss.

ChapterList.Summary: Cody presents and gets hammered; Reed's allies redirect the room; Katiya's plan withers, Bertram is "killed" in exercise, she barges the opposing house—bad optics.
ChapterList.Blurb: A tough room for Cody. A tougher match for Katiya. Plans buckle under pressure.

ChapterList.Summary: Reed's presentation wins; Cody's mild critique is spun as jealousy and he snaps publicly; Katiya loses to Aryn, is told she's below the line, and learns her family's already in Gaffesend.
ChapterList.Blurb: One wins the crowd; the other loses control. Lines are drawn on both sides.

ChapterList.Summary: Cody spirals home; Katiya waits on his couch; their mutual failures ignite a bitter fight—door slammed shut again.
ChapterList.Blurb: Back at the house, two people who need comfort get conflict instead.

ChapterList.Summary: Jackson's "Operation Bluewings" flashback: drone crash, mission abort, and his sacrificial call to Overwatch in the storm.
ChapterList.Blurb: Years earlier, in a storm of ice and static, a mission hangs by a thread.

ChapterList.Summary: Katiya's origin trauma: childhood game ? treehouse collapse ? Raph's death; she hides in a corpse pit; the Chymaeran lie brands her forever.
ChapterList.Blurb: Long before today, a childhood dare turned into a scar that never closed.

ChapterList.Summary: Months later: Naveen notes Cody's improvement but deeper ennui; company lunch where Reed is promoted; Reed asks Cody to help fix his flawed prototype (they bond); that night Cody, riding the high, uses Essence as flux—batteries "fire" and spark his next idea.
ChapterList.Blurb: Small progress, big disappointment—until a late-night spark hints at a dangerous idea.
Family news brightens the table, but Katiya's hands won't stop shaking. A walk with Erik ends at a tavern door—and a choice she should've made months ago.
New alliances form while an ominous email threatens Cody's career.
A collapse, a break-in, and a rescue drag Katiya and Cody violently back together.
Katiya's first peaceful sleep leads straight into chaotic, sword-filled "fantasy" tourism on Earth.
Tournament glory and a stolen moment of closeness are shattered with sudden news from the north.
At work, a meeting becomes a reckoning. Someone steps forward, and the cost is real.
Desperation pulls Katiya beyond the walls, where duty, grief, and old ghosts converge.
Kindness and rediscovery of an old passion dare Cody to care again.
Shame, buried memories, and unexpected visitors push both worlds toward a new kind of war.
This time, Katiya and Cody come together instead of shutting each other out.
Stories from another road change the map. A cross-world conversation reframes what "winning" could mean.
An abandoned project stops being a joke.
Turned away by authority, Katiya and her new allies make a plan anyway—three days, no permission, no safety net.
Cody raids parts bins and old code; the prototype finally breathes—then crosses into a world where failure isn't theoretical.
Cody confronts his father about a resurrected dream.
Katiya tells her family the whole truth.
Suit pressed, nerves frayed: Cody walks into the room that could end him—or open a door.
Proof flies. A name lands. The verdict doesn't.dea.
Dawn, a promise, and zero guarantees. The team rolls out while Cody watches the horizon for what no one else believes.
Fire buys time—then runs out. A second danger moves where no one is looking.
Winter arrives with teeth. Something old stirs, and Katiya gets a chance to reconcile the past.
With the city burning, Katiya chooses action.
New halls, old stairs. A photo in a locker. On the western tower, two silhouettes face what's next.
Titus enocunters someone he thought he lost.
